casebody.data:
Batris W. PEROVICH, dba B. W. Pero-vich Construction Company, Appellant, v. PIPE LININGS, INC., et al., Appellees. No. 22205. United States Court of Appeals Ninth Circuit. Sept. 3, 1969. Aaron M. Peck (argued), McKenna & Fitting, Les J. Weinstein, Los Angeles, Cal., for appellant. Robert E. Cooper (argued), of Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher, John J. Hanson, Douglas M. Hindley, Los Angeles, Cal., for appellees.

Before CHAMBERS and DUNIWAY, Circuit Judges, and SMITH, District Judge.*

Honorable Russell E. Smith, United States District Judge, Missoula, Montana, sitting by designation.

 PER CURIAM:

The District Court has a broad discretion to dismiss a case for failure to comply with its orders. We find no abuse of discretion here and the dismissal is affirmed.
